page.title: 03A STUDY OF PLEASLEY VALE
page.content: { Pleasley Vale is a local favourite {beauty spot.}The{River Meden}runs through it. The local stone is {magnesium limestone}which is still quarried here.Planning permission for its enlargement is continually under review. There are a number of mills in the Vale producing yarn for the textile industries.These are known as the {Vantura Viyella Mills. In{Pleasley Park}we found Ramsons, Blue Meadow Clarey,Herb Robert,Yellow Vetch,Willow Herb,Red Campion,Hedge Parsley,Sherperd's Purse,Hemlock, Hogweed,Clover,Jack by the Hedge, Common Sorrel,Ragwort,Ox-eye Daisy, Thale Cress,Water Dropwort,Plantain, Nettle leaved Bellflower,Chickweed. {Grasses}include reed grass,annual meadow grass,Cock's foot grass and Heath grass. {Class 5 S.E.
